wikipedia_page.main: Robert Cleghorn MD FRSE FFPSG PRMS (1755 – 18 June 1821) was a Scottish physician and pharmacologist.

response: In 1821, Shawfield House was listed as the place of death of noted chemist Robert Cleghorn, who may have been there in connection with the fledgling business of that nature described below.
*Dr Robert Cleghorn (1755-1821) - memorial by Greek Thomson reinterred here in 1875

In 1818 he became Physician to the Royal Asylum for Lunatics at Gartnavel in place of Dr Robert Cleghorn. In his role in the asylum he invented Balmanno's Syringe a device to replace force feeding for those on hunger strike. More controversially he utilised a "whirling chair" which disorientated patients.<reF>Encyclopedia of Asylum Therapeutics 1750-1950</ref>
